intro: Downingia sikota, commonly known as the Sikota rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Tanzania. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers and is often found growing on rocky outcrops and slopes. Downingia sikota has adapted to high-altitude environments with its compact growth form and drought-resistant features. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
